intro: Andrachne merxmuelleri, commonly known as the Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. Andrachne merxmuelleri is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
